newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine minister sues Cavallo for slander.
newsitem.headline: Argentine minister sues Cavallo for slander.

text.p: Argentine Interior Minister Carlos Corach on Wednesday sued former Economy Minister Domingo Cavallo, who accused him of trying to manipulate judges and hamper corruption investigations.

"There were multiple declarations by Cavallo which were considered crimes against (Corach's) honor," the minister's attorney Ricardo Klass told a television interviewer after presenting the suit against Cavallo for alleged slander.
The former minister is travelling out of the country at this time and was unavailable for comment.
Cavallo last week accused Corach and Justice Minister Elias Jassan of manipulating judges and of seeking to hinder investigations of alleged corruption by goverment officials.
In Congress, legislators met to consider whether Cavallo, who was fired by President Carlos Menem in July after seven years in the cabinet, should be called to testify.

"We consider it vital that Cavallo comes to parliament," said legislator Federico Storani of the opposition Radical Party. If Cavallo can substantiate his charges, "the natural thing to do would be to impeach" the two ministers and the judges involved, he said.
Cavallo, who has admitted he has no concrete evidence, on Monday pointed his finger at another top government official, Menem's chief of staff Alberto Kohan.

According to testimony in court printed on Wednesday by an Argentine daily, Cavallo said Kohan had indicated he was aware that government officials had paid bribes to secure a contract between state-run Banco Nacion and the U.S. computer giant IBM's local branch.
Cavallo said Kohan made those remarks at a meeting the two held with Menem. Both Menem and Kohan deny such meeting ever took place.
